children.name: scroll
Bind to scroller scroll event in view init

children.description: Fires when the user scrolls through the content.

children.name: resize
children.description: Fires when the scroller dimensions change (e.g. orientation change or resize)

children.name: pull
children.description: Fires when the pull option is set to true, and the user pulls the scrolling container beyond the specified pullThreshold.

children.name: zoomOut
children.description: Zooms the scroller out to the minimum zoom level possible.> The scroller widget is when the mobile view is resized or displayed initially. You can use the after-show event for the zoomOut call.

children.name: scrollWidth
children.description: Returns the width in pixels of the scroller content.

children.name: scrollTo

parameters.name: y `Number`
parameters.description: The vertical offset in pixels to scroll to.

parameters.name: x `Number`
parameters.description: The horizontal offset in pixels to scroll to.

children.description: Scrolls the container to the specified location. The arguments should be negative numbers.

children.name: scrollHeight
children.description: Returns the height in pixels of the scroller content.

children.name: reset
children.description: Scrolls the container to the top.

children.name: pullHandled
Custom pull to refresh view scroll handling

children.description: Indicate that the pull event is handled (i.e. data from the server has been retrieved).

children.name: height
children.description: Returns the viewport height of the scrollable element.

children.name: enable
children.description: Enables the scrolling of the element after it has been disabled by calling `disable`.

children.name: disable
children.description: Disables the scrolling of the element.

children.name: destroy
children.description: Prepares the **Scroller** for safe removal from DOM. Detaches all event handlers and removes jQuery.data attributes to avoid memory leaks. Calls destroy method of any child Kendo widgets.> **Important:** This method does not remove the Scroller element from DOM.

children.name: contentResized
children.description: Updates the scroller dimensions. Should be called after the contents of the scroller update their size

children.name: animatedScrollTo

parameters.name: y `Number`
parameters.description: The vertical offset in pixels to scroll to.

parameters.name: x `Number`
parameters.description: The horizontal offset in pixels to scroll to.

children.description: Scrolls the scroll container to the specified location with animation. The arguments should be negative numbers.

children.name: zoom
children.description: If set to true, the user can zoom in/out the contents of the widget using the pinch/zoom gesture.> The configuration option does not have any effect if the `useNative` option is set to `true`.

children.name: visibleScrollHints
children.description: If set to `true`, the scroller scroll hints will always be displayed.> The configuration option does not have any effect if the `useNative` option is set to `true`.

children.name: useNative
children.description: If set to true, the scroller will use the native scrolling available in the current platform. This should help with form issues on some platforms (namely Android and WP8).Native scrolling is only enabled on platforms that support it: iOS > 4, Android > 2, WP8. BlackBerry devices do support it, but the native scroller is flaky.

children.name: pullToRefresh
children.description: If set to true, the scroller will display a hint when the user pulls the container beyond its top limit.If a pull beyond the specified `pullOffset` occurs, a pull event will be triggered.

children.name: pullOffset
children.description: The threshold below which releasing the scroller will trigger the pull event.Has effect only when the `pullToRefresh` option is set to true.

children.name: messages.releaseTemplate
children.description: The message template displayed when the user pulls the scroller below the `pullOffset`, indicating that `pullToRefresh` will occur.Has effect only when the `pullToRefresh` option is set to `true`.

children.name: messages.refreshTemplate
children.description: The message template displayed during the refresh.Has effect only when the `pullToRefresh` option is set to `true`.

children.name: messages.pullTemplate
children.description: The message template displayed when the user pulls the scroller.Has effect only when the `pullToRefresh` option is set to `true`.

children.name: messages
children.description: Defines the text of the Scroller pull to refresh messages. Used primary for localization.

children.name: elastic
children.description: Weather or not to allow out of bounds dragging and easing.
